720535f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Houston Street (West)
720535f-a.text:
Hudson Street at West Houston (formerly Hammersley) Street, the
N. W. corner seen from and including the cleared S. E. corner.
part of the exoavation for the new United States ppraisers
Stores Building, which fills the entire block from Varick Street
to Hudson.
DDecember 7, 1927.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720535f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY

724527f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (West - Hudson Street
724527f-a.text:
297 West Houston Street (formerly 102 Hammersley Street), one of
a group of seven old houses with dormer windows on the south side
of iest Houston Street, west of Hudson Street.
In the background is shorn the King Street side of the new Standard
Statistics Building, Hudson Street from Charlton to King Streets.
July 16, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.
724527f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720539f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Houston Street (West)
720539f-a.text:
395 Hudson Street, west side, north from W. Houston (left)
to Clarkson (right) Streets, as viewed northwestward across
a clearance on the east side of Hudson Street. This loft building
hears the street address as a name and is the property of the
New York Central Railroad and forms a portion of their rast
holdings in this vicinity. It was corpleted in June 1921. To
tNe left marrin is Houston Street Station of the Ninth Avenue
''gg'' which runs north and southxard on Greenwich Street at this
point.
Sentember 4, 1938.
P.L. Sperr

395 Hudson Street, west side, Clarkson to Houston.
P. L. Sperr

724526f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (West - Hudson Street
724526f-a.text:
262 West Houston Street, north side, east of Hudson Street, adjoining
Public School No. 95. This is a shack less than eight years old,
as shown.
June 15, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724526f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

724528f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (West - Hudson Street
724528f-a.text:
(1)
301, 297 to 281 West Houston Street, south side, west of, adjoining,
and at Hudson Street, including the row of old houses with
dormer windows which used to be 102 to 92 Hammersley Street,
before 1858, when that street was absorbed by Houston Street,
losing its own name.
July 16, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Rear view of 293 to 281 West Houston Street, two years earlier.
At the right may be seen the rear of 371 Hudson Street, a four-
story tenement house in the middle of a block of much older
buildings.
April 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724528f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720538f.text:

(formerly Hammersley) and Clarkson Streets.
About 1920.
Gift of E.M. Jenks.

724525f-b.text:
Public School No. 95, 250-260 West Houston Street, north side, betwee
VVarick and Bidson Streets, seen from the cleared block on the south
side, where the new United States Appraisers Stores Building is
to be erected.
December 7, 1927.
